item.title: Blake add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Blake add a quote by Howard Phillips Lovecraft
item.description: "Almost nobody dances sober, unless they happen to be insane." -- Howard Phillips Lovecraft

item.title: Blake add a quote by Richard Kadrey
item.description: "Memories are bullets. Some whiz by and only spook you. Others tear you open and leave you in pieces." -- Richard Kadrey

item.title: Blake add a quote by Richard Kadrey
item.description: "All losers are romantics. It's what keeps us from blowing our brains out." -- Richard Kadrey

item.title: Blake add a quote by Richard Kadrey
item.description: "Try not to sing too many sad songs for yourself. The universe already hates you. Self-pity isn't going to help." -- Richard Kadrey

item.title: Blake add a quote by Richard Kadrey
item.description: "Being able to embrace contradictions is a sign of intelligence. Or insanity." -- Richard Kadrey

item.title: Blake add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Blake add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "If you think anyone is sane you just don't know enough about them." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Blake add a quote by Gene Stratton-Porter
item.description: "If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose." -- Gene Stratton-Porter

item.title: Blake add a quote by Max Brooks
item.description: "Remember; no matter how desperate the situation seems, time spent thinking clearly is never time wasted." -- Max Brooks

item.title: Blake add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Patriotism is supporting your country all the time and your government when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Blake add a quote by Jacques Derrida
item.description: "To pretend, I actually do the thing: I have therefore only pretended to pretend." -- Jacques Derrida
